page.title: 08Armed Forces Syerston.
page.content: The Ministry of Defence airfield, RAF Syerston, houses{gliding}& police dog training units. The gliding training is carried out by the Central Flying School Gliding Squadron, the Air Cadet Central Gliding School for part time gliding instructors and Number 644 Gliding School for Combined Cadet Force flying instruction. The aircraft operating from RAF Syerston includes a Chipmunk for aero towing, eight types of glider for RAF training and thirty eight private gliders belonging to the 4 Counties Gliding Club, based at the airfield. The{police dog}training involves drug and explosives searching for both RAF & HM Customs. Other training includes 'windscenting' & attack. Employees include 16 full & 1 part time workers. There are 112 married quarters used as accomadation for RAF Newton.
